fields.descriptive_line: Book (parabaik), wooden covers with gilt, glass and ivory decoration, Burma, 19th century.
fields.physical_description:
The book (parabaik) consists of two wooden covers (at top and bottom) which are gilt and covered in raised decoration, with coloured and plain glass pieces, and ivory knobs (four on the bottom cover and two on the top, the other two being missing). The illustrated text is painted with gouache, on to coarse paper and inserted between the covers in a concertina-like manner.
The "parabaik" shows a series of scenes from Mandalay court life probably during the second part of the 19th century. (Parabaiks with illustrations of  court amusements were fro court enjoyment - rather like photo albums - U Maung Maung Tin, May 1995).
The images are as follows, with Burmese text below each scene.  

Numbers are slide numbers:

Within the Palace Compound. fortified with a series of inner walls:
2. Two nobles in green pavilion with bowing figures.

3.  One nobles in green and gilded pavilion with bowing figures.

4.  King and Queen on throne in royal pavilion.  White umbrellas.  Bowing ministers.  Outside white walls; royal carriages and a pair of canons.  Waiting elephant and horses with bowing attendants and flying state banners.

5. Elephants with how-dows and uniformed mahouts.  Drum circle in an open pavilion.  Empty rickshaws, with canon pointing outward.  Ministers preparing to enter red palace doors.  Outside stockade rifles laid on the ground and minister making his way to outer palace gate.

6.  Attendants in long white coats and pasos with elephants.

7.  Attendants in long white coats and pasos with elephants and horses.

8.  Attendants in long white coats and pasos with elephants and horses.

9.  The outer red walls surrounded by a moat.  Strolling courtiers.

Outside Palace Walls:
10.  Elephants

11.  Royal palaquin and uniformed soldiers

12.  Carriage with royal pair pulled by uniformed soldiers followed by ladies-in-waiting.

13.  Splendidly uniformed soldiers followed by minsters.

14.  Bedecked horses.  Attendants with gongs.

15.  Tribal solders (?Shan), some with tattooed legs.

16.  Attendants in demon monks and costumes.  Ministers/actors playing musical instruments.

17.  Royal pair seated in a pavilion watching a pwe with musicians and actors.

18.  Monastery within white walls, visited by King and Queen in regalia robes, and ministers, all of whom have removed shoes in preparation for entering the monastery.

19.  Athletes with tattooed legs playing the balancing ball game called "chinlon".

20.  Court Ladies etc out for a stroll along an avenue bordered with looped garlands.

21.  Court Ladies etc out for a stroll along an avenue bordered with looped garlands.

22.  Court Ladies etc out for a stroll along an avenue bordered with looped garlands to visit a white pagoda.

23.  A market place with groups eating outside.

24.  A puppet show in a raised bannered theatre with bilu figures.

25.   Individuals worshipping around a white pagoda, in a monastery enclosure.

26.  Monastery and approaching worshippers.

27.  Figures in a pavilion watching an elephant tournament/fight.

28.  Elephant training with a stuffed tiger.

29.  Nat Festival.  The spirit palace at Taungbyon, nr. Mandalay.  Dancing mediums are with the orchestra on the platform, drunken revellers are below.  (See Singer "Burmese Dance and Theatre" p. 81, colour pl. 17.

30.  Nat Festival

Scenes along the Irrawaddy River:
31.  Against a background of distant hills with the occasional white pagoda and palm trees bowing in the wind a procession of court figures are depicted sailing along in choppy waters in red and gilded barges with rowers and helmsmen of different ethnic origins.  The spectacle is watched by stylishly dressed groups along the shore.  A white launch with white awning, without rowers, carrying a Burmese Gentleman.

32.  As above but the white launch appears empty.

33.  One of two fly leaves (same designs)

34.  One of two covers (2) similar to cover (1).  5 different mythical figures and 4 ivory knobs.

35.  Close up of cover (2).  Left hand figure.

36.  Close up of cover (1).  Second left and middle figure.
fields.dimensions: Length: 54.5 cm, Height: 26 cm, Depth: 11.5 cm
fields.materials_techniques: Paper, paint, wood, gilding, glass, ivory

fields.name: South and South East Asian Collection
